entry.title: Group Permissions
entry.text: Select the permissions that you want to grant to the group. If you are modifying a group, the checked permissions will be added, but unchecked ones will not be deleted unless you also check the box labeled Remove Existing Permissions.

entry.title: Group Name and Description
entry.text: Enter the name and description of the group. The name should be short and one word. The description can be longer and multiple words.

entry.title: Short tutorial on groups
entry.text:
Access to documents within the DocDB is controlled in several ways. A document may be tagged as accessible to a subset of groups. Additionally, each group may have a list of subordinate groups. Anything marked viewable by a subordinate is also viewable by its superior group. (This relationship does not extend to more than one generation, though.)
Each group also has a flag determining whether that group is allowed to create new or modify existing documents. If a group is allowed to view a document, it can change that document (assuming they also have the create/modify flag set). These group names must match those in the .htpasswd file although the comparison is not case sensitive.

entry.title: Subordinate groups
entry.text: Select the groups you want to be subordinates of this group. This means that the dominant group will be able to see and change all documents that these groups can.

entry.title: Group
entry.text: Select the group you want to delete or modify. If you want to modify, fill out the names and permissions that you want to change.

entry.title: Administrative actions
entry.text: Select the action you want to perform on the list. You can either modify an existing entry, create a new entry, or delete an entry. Then fill out the rest of form.

entry.title: Institution entry
entry.text: Fill out both the short name, (i.e. Illinois) and the long name (i.e. University of Illinois) for the institution.

entry.title: E-mail notification authors
entry.text:
Select which people you want to be notified about when they are listed as authors on documents. Immediate notification will send you e-mail on each document as it is entered. Daily and weekly notifications send out lists of documents you are interested in every night or week.
You can select any combination of authors for each of the three periods.

entry.title: E-mail notification keywords
entry.text:
Select the keywords that you want to be notified when they are entered on documents. The keywords are case insensitive, but otherwise must match exactly. Immediate notification will send you e-mail on each document as it is entered. Daily and weekly notifications send out lists of documents you are interested in every night or week.
You can select any combination of keywords for each of the three periods.

entry.title: E-mail notification topics
entry.text:
Select the topics or subtopics that you want to be notified about for the selected time period. Immediate notification will send you e-mail on each document as it is entered. Daily and weekly notifications send out lists of documents you are interested in every night or week.
You can select any combination of topics and subtopics for each of the three periods.

entry.title: Override submit date
entry.text: Use this option if you want to (by default) be able to set the date and time for documents written in the past. This is useful mainly for those entering lots of old documents.

entry.title: Name
entry.text: Select your name from the list. When you create a new document, you will be automatically selected as the requester and author.

entry.title: Sort by
entry.text: This controls how the list of documents is sorted and what is shown on the one-line summary of the document. "By Date" is usually used for generic documents and "By Author" is useful for meetings.

entry.title: File Name
entry.text: When updating the database information on a document, you can't rename the files, but you can redescribe them. These are the names of the files in your document.

entry.title: Topics
entry.text:
Using this control you can select either topics or sub-topics for the document(s) you are searching for. You can select topics on the left and sub-topics on the right. Selecting a topic on the left will limit your choices on the right (assuming you have Javascript turned on).
Selecting any sub-topic on the right ignore its parent topic on the left. This means that if you have Meetings and Detectors selected on the left and Detectors:Straws selected on the right, your search will be performed on Detectors:Straws and Meetings. But, even if you have "OR" selected for "Within Fields," you won't get documents for detectors other than straws.

entry.title: Last Modified Between
entry.text:
Use these two menus to select a date range for the document(s) you are looking for. You can leave either the start or end completely blank for an open ended search.
You can also leave months and/or days blank on one or both menus to perform searches between the beginning and end of years and months (whichever is appropriate). Unpredictable results may occur if, for instance, you leave the month blank but select a day of the month.

entry.title: Document Type
entry.text: Select the types of documents you are looking for. Note that regardless of the setting of Within Fields this search will be performed with a logical OR.

entry.title: Requester
entry.text: Select the people who might have initially requested or requested a modification to the document you are looking for. Note that regardless of the setting of Within Fields this search will be performed with a logical OR.

entry.title: Text Searches
entry.text:
These fields allow you to search on the various text items in the database. The following modes are used to search for information:
Any words as sub-string: The information you enter is broken into words (delimited by spaces) and the field you are searching in is required to match one or more of these words as a substring (lock will match lock and block).
All words as sub-string: The information you enter is broken into words (delimited by spaces) and the field you are searching in is required to match all of these words as substrings (in any order).

entry.title: Between Fields vs. Within Fields
entry.text:
Two types of logic can be used to refine your search.
The setting for Between Fields lets you select AND or OR between elements on the form. For instance, if you select and Author and a Topic, you can either find documents by that author AND on that topic or by that author OR on that topic. AND is the default.
The setting for Within Fields determines what happens when, for instance, you select two authors. You can either require that both authors are present on the paper (AND) or either author is present (OR). OR is the default. Note that this setting doesn't apply to text searches (since they use their own syntax). Also, for Requester and Document Type, multiple settings on the document are not possible, so these searches are always done with an OR.

entry.title: Keywords
entry.text: Keywords are used to further classify documents below the sub-topic level. Keywords should be seperated by spaces. Compound words should use a dash or under-score to connect words.

entry.title: Replace Duplicate Files
entry.text:
If you select this option, any files you add which duplicate file names of existing files will completely replace the old files (no backup will be kept). Yuu should not be using this option avoid creating a new version of a document, even if only minor changes have been made. This option is, instead, intended for making minor fixes to presentation formats and the like. Disk space is cheap, mistakes are not.
Please use this option responsibly.

entry.title: Authors
entry.text:
Type the names of the authors here. Put each author on a new line. Use full last names and first names or initials. Each author entered will checked against the database and a unique match must be found for all authors before the document will be added. Requiring a unique match means that for people who share a last name, the first name must be fully specified. Entered middle initials are ignored.
If you would prefer to select the author names from a list, select "Selectable List" as the author selection mode from the advanced form on the document DB home page.

entry.title: Start Date
entry.text: Select the date of the start of the conference.

entry.title: End Date
entry.text: Select the date of the end of the conference.

entry.title: Location
entry.text: Type in the location of the conference. City, state (if in the USA), and country.

entry.title: URL
entry.text: Type in the URL for the conference's homepage. Please include the http:// or https:// at the beginning.

entry.title: Document Number
entry.text: This is the number (six digits or less) of the document you want to act on. If you can supply a version number, that is always in a seperate field, don't type it here.

entry.title: Description
entry.text: This is a short description of each file. This description will appear in the hyperlink in the document summary. For instance, you might describe a .ppt file as "PowerPoint of the conference talk" and a .ps file as "The proceedings for the conference." The description is optional, but recommended.

entry.title: File
entry.text: This is a file on your local computer. You can type in a full file name or press browse to go find the file.

entry.title: URL
entry.text:
In this box, enter a URL available on the web. The file will be fetched from this URL and stored on the server. The URL must be a full URL, with http:// at the beginning and a file name at the end (cannot end in "/"). The https and ftp protocols may also work.
If the URL is protected, enter the username and password used to access the URL. The username and password are not saved.

entry.title: Modification Actions
entry.text:
There are five ways to modify a document:
Reserve a document #: Select this option if you want a number for a document you are going to write, but don't have a draft of the document.
New document: You have a new document ready to be put into the database that has not been entered before.
Update document: You have a new version of a document already in the database. You will also be able to change any of the information in the database about the document. You must supply a document number to modify.
Update database information: The document hasn't changed, but the information about it has. For example, it's now published so you want to add that information. You must supply a document number to modify.
Add/Replace files: You forgot a file that belongs with the document or something minor has changed in one of the files. To add or replace files, use the customize box at the bottom of the page.
Replacing files should be done with caution since no backup is kept. Please do not use this capability to avoid creating a new version of a document when that is more appropriate. Disk space is cheap, mistakes are not.
Select the type of modification appropriate to your situation

entry.title: Upload Methods
entry.text:
You can upload documents by two different methods.
You can upload files from your local computer
You can upload files by supplying a URL. In this case, the database system downloads the document from the location you specify.
In both cases the document is ultimately stored on the document database webserver.

entry.title: Upload Types
entry.text:
You can upload three different types of documents.
You can upload a single file. This is the default.
You can upload a document consisting of multiple files, such as PowerPoint and PDF by selecting "Multiple" and filling in the "# of files" option with the number of files you want to upload.
You can upload an archive file containing all the files in your document. However, only one of those files will be directly accessible. For example, use this option to upload a group of linked web pages. You can upload files in .tar, .tar.gz, .tgz, or .zip format.

entry.title: Topic Selection
entry.text: You can either select the subtopic(s) for your document from one long list or from a number of shorter lists split up by topic.

entry.title: Author Selection
entry.text: There are two methods of entering the authors for a document. The first is selecting the authors from a list of all possible authors. The second is to type into a form the names of the authors. However for your document to be accepted, every author that you entered must successfully match with an author in the database. The second method has not been implemented.

entry.title: Overriding the submission date
entry.text: Use this option to set the date and time for a document written in the past. Unless you are submitting a document from the old database or one written a long time ago, you should probably not check this. By default, new documents are entered with the current date and time.

entry.title: Main Files
entry.text: Files that the database knows about are classified as "Main" or "Other." Main files are typically the ones you want people to look at. As an example, the top file of several linked HTML files is a "Main File," the others are "Other Files."

entry.title: Date and Time
entry.text: Use these menus to set the date and time for a document written in the past. Unless you are submitting a document from the old database or one written a long time ago, you should not check "Override date" and you will not have to use this control. For your convenience, the date has been set to approximately the current time.

entry.title: Title
entry.text: This is the initial title of of your document. This option must be supplied for when placing a document into the database and when reserving a document number.

entry.title: Requester
entry.text: This is the name of the person who is requesting the document number or placing the document in the database. In other words, this is you. This option must be supplied when reserving a document number, placing a document into the database, or updating a document.

entry.title: Publication Information
entry.text:
In this field, include any additional publication information that can't be placed in the boxes above. Valid URLs entered here will be linked for the user. This field is optional.
If your document is in a journal or preprint archive that you feel should be added to the list in the DocDB, please contact an administrator.

entry.title: References
entry.text:
In this space, add any references to journals or archives for your document. If the journal or archive does not exist and you feel should be added to the list in the DocDB, please contact an administrator.
If you already have more than one reference for your document, add the first one now. When the document is entered, select Update DB Info and add the other ones. Each time you "Update DB Info" you are given the chance to add one additional reference.

entry.title: Abstract
entry.text: Include here an abstract of your document. A short description of the topic(s) discussed. This is optional during the reservation stage, but required when adding or updating a document.

entry.title: File upload
entry.text:
This field will upload a file from your local computer to the database server. Usually you will press the "Browse" button to select, from your local file system, the file to be uploaded. The base file name cannot contain a back slash "\" or a forward slash "/" to preserve compatibility with both Windows and Unix.
You can also enter a short description of each file, which will appear in the summary of the document. The description is optional.
If there are more upload boxes than you need, just leave the last ones blank.
If you want to submit a URL rather than a local file, use the Customize Insert/Modify functions to select your type of upload.

entry.title: Authors
entry.text:
If entering a new document, select all the authors of the document. If you would prefer to type in the author names individually, select "Text Field" as the author selection mode from the advanced form on the document DB home page.
If searching for a document, select the authors appropriately for your setting of Within Fields.
To select multiple authors either click (Netscape 4.x) or CTRL-click (Netscape 6.x, Internet Explorer) on the author names.

entry.title: Topics
entry.text: Select all the topics and subtopics for the document. To select multiple topics either click (Netscape 4.x) or CTRL-click (Netscape 6.x, Internet Explorer) on the topic names. Note that there are two ways to enter topics, either from one big long list or from several shorter lists. You can select the other mode from the customize form on the main page.

entry.title: Security
entry.text: Select which username/password pairs you want to allow access to your document. To select more than one pair, either click (Netscape 4.x) or CTRL-click (Netscape 6.x, Internet Explorer) on them. You can make a document public by leaving all selections blank. Selecting "Public" doesn't actually do anything except generate a warning if you combine "Public" with another name.

entry.title: Document Type
entry.text: Select which kind of document this is. This has nothing to do with the format of the document. I.e. a PowerPoint file isn't necessarily a "Talk."

entry.title: Major Topics
entry.text: Select the Major topic which is the parent of the minor, or subtopic you are entering. New major topics can currently only be entered into the database directly (there is no web form).

entry.title: Short Description of Subtopic or Conference
entry.text:
This is the text that appears in the selectable boxes and in the ShowDocument script.
For conferences, this should be the short name of the conference, like "High Energy 6."

entry.title: Long Description of Subtopic or Conference
entry.text:
This is a longer description of the topic, if needed. If not, it should be the same as the short description. While this isn't used now, it might be in the future.
For conferences, this should be the full name of the conference, like "The Sixth International Conference of Interactions at High Energy."

entry.title: Institution
entry.text: The institution the author you are entering is associated with.

entry.title: Entering the Author's Name
entry.text: Fill in the fields for first and last name as well as the middle initials, if needed.

entry.title: Upload by URL
entry.text:
Enter a URL for your document. The file will be fetched from this URL and stored on the server. The URL must be a full URL, with http:// at the beginning and a file name at the end (cannot end in "/"). The https and ftp protocols may also work.
If the URL is password protected, enter the username and password for the URL here. The username and password are NOT saved.
You can also enter a short description of each file, which will appear in the summary of the document. The description is optional.
